name: Crochet a toy for your cat
description: Join us for a hands-on workshop inspired by our latest exhibition, The Many Lives of the Cat. Learn how to create charming, handmade toys your feline friends will adore. Whether you’re a crochet novice or a seasoned maker, you’ll leave with a unique toy and the skills to craft more at home. Just bring your creativity (and your cat’s playful spirit) to the workshop!

name: Laal Aasmaan, Hara Gulaab, Neeli Dharti
description:
Image credits: Harkat Studios
Fragments of unfinished verses swirl in an orbit, finding their way to each other, bewitched. They dance for a while, hand in hand, and then drop to the ground- to catch a breath, a smile, a moment in time; to sit together. Content. Then they get up to dance again before they say their goodbyes.

Images from the past, present and future, all collide to construct wild imaginations. Colors form, hide and show. Pass through images, like shadows of clouds. Fleeting. They meet each other in dark alleys, and kiss, and melt. Like a flirt with the mysticism of cinema.

Using two 16mm projectors with a live projectionist-performer, this performance explores visual juxtapositions and photochemical experiments, blending theatre, mechanics, and chemistry into a playful exploration of what film can be.

Performed by Karan Suri Talwar
Music by Baan

Harkat Crew for Sound and Additional Visuals: Tanvi Chitre, Keyuri Bhogale 
Originally devised with Namrata and Simran, Harkat Lab.

name: Paws & Listen: Kannada Guided Walk
description:
How has the most meme’able, memorable, and mischievous animal known to man been represented across art history in the subcontinent? Through Kalighat paintings, miniatures, and popular imagery, our latest exhibition, The Many Lives of the Cat highlights how the cat has served as both muse and mirror — embodying humour, critique, and affection across time.

Join us for a walkthrough of this exhibition in Kannada and discover how this enigmatic animal has captivated artists, storytellers, and audiences for generations.

This programme is in conjunction with the exhibition The Many Lives of Cats

name: Paws & Listen: The Curator's Perspective
description:
How has the most meme’able, memorable, and mischievous animal known to man been represented across art history in the subcontinent? Through Kalighat paintings, miniatures, and popular imagery, our latest exhibition, The Many Lives of the Cat highlights how the cat has served as both muse and mirror — embodying humour, critique, and affection across time.

Join our curator Khushi Bansal for an intimate walkthrough of this exhibition and discover how this enigmatic animal has captivated artists, storytellers, and audiences for generations.

This programme is in conjunction with the exhibition The Many Lives of Cats

name: Odissi Odyssey
description:
Image credits: Karthik Venkatraman
Let celestial stories move through you. Join Surupa Sen from Nrityagram as she guides you through the processional movements of Odissi, where mythology and motion become one.

This programme is in conjunction with the exhibition In Celestial Company.

Facilitated by arts practitioners, Responding to Art through the Arts aims to activate our galleries through a series of workshops that hold space for young people’s personal and creative responses to artworks on display.

name: Paws & Sign: ISL Walkthrough
description:
How has the most meme’able, memorable, and mischievous animal known to man been represented across art history in the subcontinent? Through Kalighat paintings, miniatures, and popular imagery, our latest exhibition, The Many Lives of the Cat highlights how the cat has served as both muse and mirror — embodying humour, critique, and affection across time.

Join us for a walkthrough of this exhibition in Indian Sign Language (ISL) and discover how this enigmatic animal has captivated artists, storytellers, and audiences for generations.

This programme is in conjunction with the exhibition The Many Lives of Cats

name: Meow-mories in the Making
description:
Image credits: Raeesa Maanal
Do you have photographs and memories of your cat(s) you’d like to preserve? In conjunction with our latest exhibition, The Many Lives of the Cat, join artist Raeesa Maanal for a hands-on workshop that explores personal archiving and visual storytelling.

Participants are encouraged to bring photographs and mementos of their cats to create a handcrafted photo album. The session explores ideas of memory, materiality, and care—transforming intimate recollections into tangible records.

name: Hand-drawn Film Workshop
description:
Image credits: Harkat Studios
The possibilities of cinema are endless, and one of the most liberating roads one can take is to make moving images without cameras, lenses, or editing programs.

We invite you to step into a world where you interact with the materiality of film directly—where images are made using craft materials, plants, and photochemistry. In this workshop, you will get hands-on knowledge of tinting and toning film, scratching and frame-by-frame animation, phytograms, collage-making with film, and more.

Watch your short creations on a 16mm projector and take home a little souvenir!

This workshop is part of Collection (film ephemera) programming

name: Cat-ch Your Vibe: Tote Printing Workshop
description:
Which cat are you? Mischievous, lazy, political, or fierce? Join our screen printing workshop inspired by  our latest exhibition, The Many Lives of the Cat and bring your feline personality to life on a tote bag. Learn simple screen printing techniques and take home a custom creation that's uniquely yours.

This programme is in conjunction with the exhibition The Many Lives of Cats

name: Purrfect Tales: Children’s Storytelling Session
description:
Join us for a playful storytelling session filled with wonder and cat adventures! From jungle cats to curious kittens, we’ll explore magical tales that celebrate our feline friends. Get ready to explore a world of stories where every cat has a tale to tell!

This programme is in conjunction with the exhibition The Many Lives of Cats.
